title: Installing cargo-spellcheck produces an ICE on nightly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When installing cargo-spellcheck with `cargo install cargo-spellcheck --locked` an ICE is produced. My CI started failing with this today, so I think it was working fine on previous nightly versions. ### Code I don't have a minial example :( ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (ab654863c 2023-03-15) binary: rustc commit-hash: ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010 commit-date: 2023-03-15 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` [](error: internal compiler error: /rustc/ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010/compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/outlives/env.rs:145:26: add_outlives_bounds: unexpected regions) ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: /rustc/ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010/compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/outlives/env.rs:145:26: add_outlives_bounds: unexpected regions thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1644:9 stack backtrace: Compiling bimap v0.6.2 0: 0x7f3d36ab750a -
